thread.title: UMD's Soucy Suspended for Friday's Game
thread.title_full: UMD's Soucy Suspended for Friday's Game

title: UMD's Soucy Suspended for Friday's Game
text:
UMD's Soucy Suspended for Friday's Game 
By Zach Schneider UMD's Soucy Suspended for Friday's Game October 13, 2015 Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 1:13 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) junior defenseman Carson Soucy has been suspended for one game by the National Collegiate Hockey Conference (NCHC) and will miss Friday night's game against Minnesota, it was announced on Tuesday afternoon. 
Soucy was assessed a five-minute major and also ejected from the Bulldogs' season opener late in the first period for a contact to the head penalty stemming from an open-ice hit on Bemidji State's Leo Fitzgerald. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
The NCHC referenced the fact that Fitzgerald did not have the puck at the time of the hit as playing a significant part in its decision. 
Soucy will sit out the front end of UMD's home-and-home series against Minnesota, but he will be eligible to return for Saturday's game.
